questions.question_text:
You are configuring Dynamics 365 Finance to make sure that the typical secure SMTP settings are used for sending email.
You make sure that In-place hold and Litigation hold are enabled.
Does this action ensure that secure SMTP settings are used?

discussion.content:
B is the correct answer
Litigation and In-Place Hold have nothing to do with SMTP
Litigation Hold uses the LitigationHoldEnabled property of a mailbox to place mailbox content on hold. Whereas In-Place Hold provides granular hold capability based on query parameters and the ability to place multiple holds, Litigation Hold only allows you to place all items on hold

Quick google search on the subject:

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/security-and-compliance/in-place-and-litigation-holds

Based on that I think the answer is no.

B. It is a compulsory setup: Fiscal calendars are a necessary configuration in financial accounting. They define the structure and timing of financial periods for reporting and analysis. Without a fiscal calendar, it would not be possible to accurately track and report financial data.

C. It can be used for a fixed asset calendar: Fiscal calendars can be utilized for fixed asset management. Having a synchronized fiscal calendar ensures consistency and accuracy in financial reporting and asset management.
